intro: Enteropogonopsis brandegeei, commonly known as the Brandegee's false wheatgrass, is a member of the grass family (Poaceae). It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and compact growth habit. Native to the southwestern United States, it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems, supporting various pollinators and soil stability.
